intro: Calochortus venustus var. oculatus, commonly known as the showy globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it produces distinctive, globe-shaped seed pods that split open to release seeds. Calochortus venustus var. oculatus is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to local pollinators.
